doc.field: Bella C. Landauer Collection of Business and Advertising Ephemera
Bella C. Landauer Collection of Business and Advertising Ephemera
Series V: PHOTOGRAPHS and FINE ART WORKS
Series V: PHOTOGRAPHS and FINE ART WORKS

This series includes photographs, prints and paintings that are not related to advertising. Photographs include four gelatin silver prints of the conductors Arthur Rodzinsky, Bruno Walter Schlesinger, and Leopold Stokowski conducting various orchestras. Fine art prints contain the etchings, Sleighing in New York, by Henry Ziegler and Bob Hulse, Masterprinter, by Haydon Jones, and a Japanese print of Audubon discovering his drawings destroyed by mice. Also included are twelve Japanese paintings of tea growing and harvesting.
